background.description: The Advanced Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) is a modern standard for evaluating text readability and visual accessibility based on human perception. Unlike traditional contrast ratios, APCA leverages advanced perceptual science to assess how humans perceive contrast across different colors, luminance levels, and text sizes.
background.shift: APCA represents a shift from fixed thresholds to a more nuanced approach that accounts for

list.color-impact: The impact of background and foreground colors on readability

background.real-world: This approach ensures accessible design tailored to real-world viewing conditions, making it especially valuable for modern digital interfaces.

calculation.description: The Advanced Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) is a modern standard for evaluating text readability and visual accessibility based on human perception. Unlike traditional contrast ratios, APCA leverages advanced perceptual science to assess how humans perceive contrast across different colors, luminance levels, and text sizes.
calculation.overview: APCA calculates contrast using a formula based on the relative luminance of foreground and background colors. The output is a score, measured in Lightness Contrast (Lc), which determines whether the combination is legible. Here's a quick overview

relative-luminance.title: Relative Luminance
relative-luminance.description: APCA evaluates the perceived brightness of colors, factoring in the non-linear way humans perceive light.

directional-contrast.title: Directional Contrast
directional-contrast.description: The score reflects whether the foreground text is darker or lighter than the background.

dynamic-thresholds.title: Dynamic Thresholds
dynamic-thresholds.description: Different text sizes and weights have distinct thresholds for accessibility.

example-list.body-text: Small, body text requires an Lc value of 75 or higher.
example-list.large-text: Large or bold text is readable at lower contrast, with a threshold of 60 or higher.

calculation.replaces: The algorithm replaces the traditional "contrast ratio" and focuses on achieving visual clarity aligned with the natural perception of contrast.

levels.description: APCA does not use fixed "pass/fail" thresholds but instead provides dynamic guidance based on text characteristics

non-text.title: Non-Text Elements
non-text.description: Lc ≥ 45 for UI elements like icons and dividers.
